lines.text: You're putting on weight.
The coat's shrunk.
So have all your coats it seems.
Now look here, I can prove to you that...
Well, you prove it to the bathroom scales.
I frequently consult the scales.
Yes, but you don't pay any attention to what they say.
What? Give up my children?
You've had them long enough, haven't you? Well, divide them up then.
I couldn't do that. There are three of them. It wouldn't come out even.
Cath, mustn't it be queer to be old like parents? To know that nothing exciting can ever happen to you?
It must be jolly peaceful. They haven't a worry in the world.
Woman are on a higher plain than men.
I'm not, that's certain. Or I wouldn't be letting you talk to me like this.
It's a changing world, my dear. People are changing their motors, their vacuum cleaners and their husbands all the time.
What time is it? You're beginning to think I haven't any family. Not even a husband.
Does he beat you?
What?
Does he beat you?
Who, Roger? Good heavens, no!
Oh, but he must. It's only fair. You're desperate and unhappy and I've come to your rescue. That's the way it's got to be.
Oh, you're really a most difficult man!
What are you doing with the Times?
Reading it.
Well don't muck it about. I hate reading a paper after a woman's got to it.
When a man wants a radish, he wants a radish.
